ygData.subject: RE: Support Bards WAS Re: Re:a lot of topics
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey, I am a necro on the Rathe, just made 6th level last night, if you wanna team up I won t ask you to tank.  I play a bard on another server, he s currently
ygData.messageBody:
Hey, I am a necro on the Rathe, just made 6th level last night, if you wanna
team up I won't ask you to tank. I play a bard on another server, he's
currently 17th level, so I wanted to try another class. So far Necro has
been the one I enjoyed, Bard is still the best tho.

Anyway, if you wanna team up after I gain a couple more levels, I will be
glad to play with you.


Conadorn
6th level Necro - The Rathe
Wenaddar
17th level Bard - Cazic-Thule



> -----Original Message-----
> From: TommyC [SMTP:uber_sorcerer@...]
> Sent: Saturday, July 17, 1999 11:23 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Support Bards WAS Re: [eqbards] Re:a lot of topics
>
> From: "TommyC" <uber_sorcerer@...>
>
> I must say that in 11 levels of playing the only time I wasn't forced to
> tank was in a group last night the the group leader playes a 27th level
> bard. Most of the time if I tell my group that i will just heal and buff
> they will tell me to fight or leave the group.....so I fight.
> Pinen
> Hopeless Bard of the Rathe
> Master Brewer of the NwN
> Bard of the 11th Song
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re:a lot of topics
>
>
> > From: RON_TALBOT@...
> >
> > I would love to be a 'support' Bard but there seems to be an
> endemic
> > shortage of tanks on my server. I am always pressed into service
> as
> a
> > tank. Sigh. And the couple of time I was in a group where it
> might
> > have worked everyone in the group though I was 'slacking' by not
> > wanting to fight.<snip>
> > Bujold 17th
> > Xegony
> > > From: "Lea G" <keylimes@...>
> > > Hail Fellow Bards,
> >
> > [re: successful leveling]
> > I advise all bards overly concerned with the best weapons and damage
> dealt,
> > to review the gifts that you have been given. Nothing sickens me more
> than
> > seeing a forceful party in danger, while the bard is selfishly fighting.
> > SHAME ON THAT BARD!<snip>
